schemes.name: PM-KISAN (Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi)
schemes.description: Direct income support of ₹6,000/year to all landholding farmer families, paid in 3 equal installments of ₹2,000 each (April–July, August–November, December–March). Over 11 crore farmer families covered with ₹3.04 lakh crore disbursed across 18+ installments.

eligibility.income_limit: Must not be income tax payer
eligibility.other: Not for institutional landholders, current/former MPs/MLAs/Mayors/Ministers, Central/State govt employees (except Class IV/Multi-Tasking Staff), retired pensioners with pension >₹10,000/month, professionals (doctors, engineers, lawyers, CAs) with practice income

documents: Aadhaar card (mandatory — linked to bank account)
schemes.how_to_apply: Online at pmkisan.gov.in → 'New Farmer Registration' → Enter Aadhaar + State → Fill form → Upload documents. Offline: Visit nearest Common Service Centre (CSC) or local agriculture office. Check status: pmkisan.gov.in → 'Beneficiary Status' → Enter Aadhaar or account number.

schemes.name: PMFBY (Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana)
schemes.description: Comprehensive crop insurance against crop loss/damage due to natural calamities, pests, and diseases at highly subsidized premiums. Covers pre-sowing failure, standing crop losses, post-harvest losses (14 days), and localized calamities. Government pays remaining premium (shared equally between Centre & State). About 4.5 crore farmer applications per year.
schemes.amount: Farmer premium: Kharif 2%, Rabi 1.5%, Commercial/Horticulture 5% of sum insured. Claims based on yield shortfall formula.

eligibility.other: All farmers — landowners, tenant farmers, sharecroppers growing notified crops in notified areas. Voluntary for all farmers since Kharif 2020 (including loanee/KCC farmers). Must enroll before cut-off date for each crop/season.

documents: Land records (Khasra/Khatauni) or lease agreement for tenant farmers
Crop damage photographs (for localized calamity claims)
FIR or panchnama (for specific calamity claims)
schemes.how_to_apply: Online at pmfby.gov.in → Register → Select State, District, Block, Crop → Pay premium → Get policy. Through bank: KCC holders can enroll via their bank branch. CSC centres or 'Crop Insurance' mobile app on Google Play. Report crop loss within 72 hours via app, toll-free 14447, bank, or local agriculture officer.

schemes.name: KCC (Kisan Credit Card)
schemes.ministry: Ministry of Finance + Ministry of Agriculture
schemes.description: Short-term crop loan + working capital for agriculture at subsidized interest. Operates like a revolving credit facility with ATM-enabled RuPay debit card. Interest rate 7% p.a., effective 4% with prompt repayment subvention (3% GoI subvention for loans up to ₹3 lakh). No collateral up to ₹1.60 lakh. 5-year validity with annual renewal, 10% limit increase each year.
schemes.amount: Loan limit based on Scale of Finance × Area + post-harvest needs. Max ₹1.60 lakh without collateral. Effective interest rate: 4% p.a. (with subvention), can be as low as 2% with additional prompt repayment incentive.

eligibility.other: All farmers — owner cultivators, tenant farmers, oral lessees, sharecroppers. SHGs and JLGs eligible. Fishermen and animal husbandry farmers included since 2019. Co-borrower required above 60 years.

documents: Aadhaar card + PAN card (PAN for loans above ₹1.60 lakh)
Land records (Khasra/Khatauni, Patta, or tenant/lease agreement)
schemes.how_to_apply: Visit nearest branch of any commercial bank, cooperative bank, or Regional Rural Bank (RRB). Submit documents, bank verifies land records, approval within 14 days. Some banks offer online KCC application (SBI, PNB, etc.). Special drive to issue KCC to all PM-KISAN registered farmers.
schemes.helpline: Contact nearest bank branch or NABARD office

schemes.name: Soil Health Card Scheme
schemes.description: Free Soil Health Cards issued to all farmers every 2 years, testing 12 parameters (pH, EC, OC, N, P, K, S, Zn, Fe, Cu, Mn, B) with colour-coded results (Green=sufficient, Yellow=moderate, Red=deficient) and specific fertilizer recommendations per crop. Over 23 crore cards distributed. Grid-based sampling: 2.5 ha for irrigated, 10 ha for rainfed areas.

eligibility.other: Any farmer can get a Soil Health Card — no restrictions. Available through Krishi Vigyan Kendras, Agriculture Department offices, or trained soil sampling agents.

documents: No mandatory documents — just visit nearest KVK or agriculture office
Land location details helpful for mapping
schemes.how_to_apply: Through Krishi Vigyan Kendra (KVK), State Agriculture Department, or block-level agriculture office. Online: soilhealth.dac.gov.in → Enter state/district → Download card (if already tested). Mobile: Soil Health Card App — scan QR code on card for digital access. Farmers save ₹2,000–₹5,000/ha by following card recommendations.
schemes.helpline: Contact state agriculture department or nearest KVK

schemes.name: eNAM (National Agriculture Market)
schemes.description: Pan-India electronic trading portal linking 1,389+ APMC mandis across 23 states and 4 UTs for transparent price discovery, online bidding, and seamless inter-state trade of 200+ agricultural commodities. Operated by Small Farmers' Agribusiness Consortium (SFAC). Online payment via RTGS/NEFT directly to farmer's bank account. 2,000+ FPOs registered.
schemes.amount: N/A — platform for better price discovery. Farmers typically get 5-15% higher prices through transparent auction.

eligibility.other: All farmers, tenant farmers, FPO members can register. Registration is FREE. Available in Hindi, English, and regional languages.

schemes.how_to_apply: Visit nearest eNAM-linked mandi and approach mandi secretary/help desk. Online: enam.gov.in → 'Farmer Registration' → Fill details → Get eNAM ID. Through FPOs: Farmer Producer Organizations register members collectively. To sell: Bring produce to eNAM mandi → Quality testing → Online bidding by traders → Accept/reject bid → Payment to bank account.
schemes.states: 23 states + 4 UTs with 1,389+ mandis. Major: UP (118), Rajasthan (144), Maharashtra (122), MP (80), Gujarat (79), TN (63), Karnataka (62)

schemes.name: PM Kisan MaanDhan Yojana (Farmer Pension)
schemes.description: Voluntary contributory pension scheme for Small and Marginal Farmers (SMF). Guaranteed monthly pension of ₹3,000 (₹36,000/year) after age 60. 50:50 contribution by farmer and Central Government. Fund managed by LIC. Family pension: spouse receives 50% (₹1,500/month) after farmer's death. About 22 lakh farmers enrolled.
schemes.amount: ₹3,000/month pension after age 60. Monthly contribution: ₹55 (age 18) to ₹200 (age 40), matched equally by government.

eligibility.income_limit: Not income tax payer. Not covered under NPS/EPFO/PM Shram Yogi Maandhan
eligibility.other: Small and Marginal Farmers with cultivable land up to 2 hectares as per land records. PM-KISAN beneficiaries can auto-debit contribution from PM-KISAN installment.

documents: Savings bank account / Jan Dhan account
schemes.how_to_apply: Visit nearest CSC (Common Service Centre) with Aadhaar and bank passbook. Online: maandhan.in → Select 'PM Kisan MaanDhan Yojana' → Self-enrollment using Aadhaar + mobile OTP. Can also link during PM-KISAN registration/update. Enrollment is FREE.

schemes.name: PKVY (Paramparagat Krishi Vikas Yojana)
schemes.description: Promotes organic farming through cluster-based approach with ₹50,000/ha financial assistance over 3 years. Covers organic inputs (₹31,000/ha), value addition & marketing (₹8,800/ha), PGS certification (₹3,000/ha), and cluster formation & training (₹7,200/ha). Funds via DBT. Over 48,000 clusters formed covering ~7.5 lakh hectares.
schemes.amount: ₹50,000/hectare over 3 years (bio-fertilizers, bio-pesticides, vermicompost, certification, marketing support)

eligibility.other: Cluster requirement: Minimum 20 farmers forming a group with at least 20 hectares (50 acres) of contiguous/nearby land. Priority for tribal areas, rainfed areas, hilly/northeastern regions. Each cluster needs a Lead Resource Person (LRP).

documents: Cluster formation application with 20+ farmer details
Individual farmer Aadhaar and land records
schemes.how_to_apply: Form a cluster of 20+ farmers with 20+ hectares → Contact District Agriculture Officer or State Agriculture Department. Online: pgsindia-ncof.gov.in → Register cluster and individual farmers. Through KVK or registered NGOs/FPOs. PGS certification is FREE under PKVY.
schemes.helpline: Contact District Agriculture Officer or nearest KVK

schemes.name: SMAM (Sub-Mission on Agricultural Mechanization)
schemes.description: Promotes farm mechanization with subsidies of 40-50% on farm equipment for individual farmers, 80% for Farm Machinery Banks by FPOs/SHGs. Covers tractors (up to 20 HP), power tillers, seed drills, paddy transplanters, sprayers, drone sprayers (since 2023), harvesters, post-harvest equipment, and solar-powered equipment. Budget ~₹1,200 crore annually. Over 15 lakh farmers benefited.
schemes.amount: Small/Marginal & SC/ST/Women/NE farmers: 50% subsidy. General farmers: 40%. Custom Hiring Centres: 40%. Farm Machinery Banks (FPO/SHG): 80%.

eligibility.other: All farmers eligible. Higher subsidy (50%) for Small/Marginal, SC/ST, Women, and NE region farmers. FPOs and SHGs eligible for Farm Machinery Banks at 80% subsidy.

schemes.how_to_apply: Online: agrimachinery.nic.in → Register as farmer → Select equipment → Upload documents → Apply. Selection on first-come-first-served basis (some states use lottery). DBT: Subsidy credited to bank after purchase verification by agriculture department officer. Timeline: 30-90 days from application to disbursement.

schemes.name: PMKSY (Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchayee Yojana)
schemes.description: 'Har Khet Ko Pani' — ensure irrigation access to every farm. 'Per Drop More Crop' — promote micro-irrigation (drip/sprinkler) with 55% Centre subsidy + additional 10-20% from states, so farmer pays only 15-25%. Components include Accelerated Irrigation Benefits Programme (AIBP), water source creation, micro-irrigation, and watershed development.
schemes.amount: 55% Centre subsidy + state share for drip/sprinkler systems. Farmer pays only 15-25% of total cost. Additional subsidies for SC/ST/small farmers in some states.

eligibility.other: All farmers with irrigable land. Priority for water-stressed areas and small/marginal farmers. Some states provide 100% subsidy for micro-irrigation to small farmers (e.g., Tamil Nadu up to 5 acres).

schemes.how_to_apply: Through state agriculture/horticulture departments. Apply via state agriculture portal or district agriculture/horticulture office. Some states have dedicated micro-irrigation portals.

schemes.name: PM-KUSUM (Pradhan Mantri Kisan Urja Suraksha evam Utthaan Mahabhiyan)
schemes.ministry: Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE)
schemes.description: Solar energy for farmers to reduce diesel/electricity dependence for irrigation. Component A: Solar plants on barren land (earn ₹60,000–₹1,00,000/year/MW selling solar power). Component B: Standalone solar pumps up to 7.5 HP with 60% subsidy (30% Centre + 30% State). Component C: Solarization of existing grid-connected pumps — sell surplus power to DISCOM.
schemes.amount: Component B: 60% subsidy on standalone solar pumps (farmer pays 40%). Component A: Income from selling solar power. Component C: Savings from solar + revenue from surplus power.

eligibility.other: Component A: Farmers with barren/fallow land. Component B: Any farmer needing irrigation pump. Component C: Farmers with existing grid-connected pumps.

documents: Existing electricity connection details (for Component C)
schemes.how_to_apply: Through state renewable energy development agencies. Portal: mnre.gov.in/kusum. Contact state DISCOM for Component C (solarization of existing pumps).
schemes.helpline: Contact state renewable energy agencies or DISCOM

schemes.name: RKVY-RAFTAAR (Rashtriya Krishi Vikas Yojana)
schemes.description: Incentivizes states to increase public investment in agriculture. Supports agri-business startups and innovation. Funding: ₹9,000+ crore annually (Centre:State = 60:40). Infrastructure creation: cold storage, pack houses, seed processing, farm-to-market roads. Agri-startup component: up to ₹25 lakh for agriculture entrepreneurs/startups.
schemes.amount: Up to ₹25 lakh for agri-startups. Infrastructure projects as per approved DPR.

eligibility.other: Agri-startup component open to aspiring agri-entrepreneurs. Infrastructure benefits through state agriculture departments.

schemes.how_to_apply: For startups: Apply through state agriculture department or RKVY-RAFTAAR incubation centres. For infrastructure: State agriculture departments prepare District/State plans for approval.

schemes.name: NBHM (National Beekeeping & Honey Mission)
schemes.description: Launched 2020 under Aatmanirbhar Bharat. Promotes scientific beekeeping, increases honey production, and provides additional income to farmers. Subsidy on beehive boxes, honey processing units, and training. Additional income of ₹15,000–₹50,000/year per farmer with 10-50 bee colonies.
schemes.amount: Subsidy on beehive boxes, equipment, and processing units. Additional farm income ₹15,000–₹50,000/year with 10-50 colonies.

eligibility.other: Any farmer, especially those with horticultural crops (mango, coconut, sunflower, mustard) for cross-pollination benefits.

schemes.how_to_apply: Through state agriculture/horticulture departments or National Bee Board (NBB). Training provided through KVKs and beekeeping centres.
schemes.helpline: National Bee Board / State horticulture department

schemes.name: NFSM (National Food Security Mission)
schemes.description: Aims to increase production of rice, wheat, pulses, coarse cereals, nutri-cereals, and oilseeds through area expansion, productivity enhancement, and technology demonstration. Provides subsidized certified seeds (50-100% subsidy), demonstration plots, and improved technology adoption.
schemes.amount: 50-100% subsidy on certified seeds, demonstration plot support, technology adoption assistance.

eligibility.other: Farmers in major food crop growing districts. Focus on rice, wheat, pulses, coarse/nutri-cereals, oilseeds.

schemes.how_to_apply: Through district agriculture offices. Demonstration plots organized through KVKs. Seed distribution through agriculture extension network.

schemes.name: NMEO-OP (National Mission on Edible Oils — Oil Palm)
schemes.description: Launched 2021 to increase domestic oilseed production with special focus on oil palm cultivation in NE India and A&N Islands. Provides ₹29,000/ha for FFB price assurance, ₹51,000/ha planting subsidy, and input support for 4 years.
schemes.amount: ₹51,000/ha planting subsidy + ₹29,000/ha FFB price assurance + input support for 4 years.

eligibility.other: Farmers in identified oil palm suitable areas, especially NE India and Andaman & Nicobar Islands.

schemes.how_to_apply: Through state agriculture/horticulture departments and identified oil palm processing companies in the area.
schemes.states: Focus: NE states, Andaman & Nicobar, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, Goa, Kerala

schemes.name: PM-FME (PM Formalization of Micro Food Processing Enterprises)
schemes.description: Provides financial, technical, and business support for upgrading micro food processing enterprises. Credit-linked subsidy of 35% of eligible project cost (max ₹10 lakh) for individual micro units. Support for SHGs, FPOs, and cooperatives for common infrastructure.
schemes.amount: 35% credit-linked subsidy up to ₹10 lakh for individual micro food processing units.

eligibility.other: Existing micro food processing enterprises or new units. One District One Product (ODOP) approach — priority for locally relevant products.

schemes.how_to_apply: Apply through state nodal agencies for PM-FME scheme. Online portal for applications. District Resource Persons (DRPs) assist in application preparation.
schemes.helpline: Contact state food processing department or district industries centre
